edu.blackburn.cs.cs212.restaurantbase

Interface Orderable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MenuItem

    public interface Orderable
    Defines required methods for an item to be orderable, that is, it can be added to a receipt. Works with MenuItem and subclasses (and anything else that might later implement Orderable)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Money getPrice()
      Total price for the item and its subitems (if there are subitems)
      java.lang.String getReceiptItem()
      Should return at least one line including an item and its subitems The item name should be on the left side and its price (right side) subitems should be indented, and the top price should be the total for the item and all subparts e.g.:

    • Method Detail

      • getPrice

        Money getPrice()
        Total price for the item and its subitems (if there are subitems)
        Returns:
        the total price for an item

      • getReceiptItem

        java.lang.String getReceiptItem()
        Should return at least one line including an item and its subitems The item name should be on the left side and its price (right side) subitems should be indented, and the top price should be the total for the item and all subparts e.g.: 
         Large Fries     $5.67
        or 
        Sandwich        $8.75
    Cheese       $1.00
    Bacon        $2.50
        Returns:
        string containing an item and its subitems; MUST FORMAT NICELY
